title: Every game is so one sided these days :/
body: Ive been playing lol for 4 years ish now i think I'm not quite sure, but a while anyway, and only this year have games been getting so one sided, its ridiculous, like every game is 8/35 or 40/10 or something stupid like that, and tbh I'm sick of it, nether team has as much fun as a good close game. why is it only this year that this has been happening? is it an imbalance in gameplay or buffs/nerfs or what? and how can we fix it?

replies.body: This is Lol, where at least 60% of most players start to curse,rage and swear at their team after 1 mistake. Leading to the whole team spirit to go down and making their team play worse. If you are tired of one sided matches you should start playing aram. Doesn't matter if you die, most people don't give a $hit unless you are 0/99/1. ;)
Absolutely agree.  Its either a white wash or a stomping and very uncommon to get a long and close game.

Even Bronzes game has the same problem! It has to do with Riot's Match Making. It is time Riot to have a closer look at how Match Making should be doe.

Riot nerfed turrets because of a Turtle meta (Heaps of games entire teams were turtling and it was hard to dive when people camped those base turrets because they shredded ur damage) so games are typically one sided because those base turrets are next to useless now lol.

The jungle has been a heavy point of balance so map wide pressure has been reduced (the jungle has been balanced more, so it's harder to pressure lanes)

Won a fight? Good. You get free wards, now go ward the crap out of everything and they're f*cked.

Want to farm a lane? Bad luck, you have to team fights - almost all farm lanes have been abolished. If you lose fights, enjoy having your buffs stolen, dragon taken (now gives buffs) or baron taken. Enjoy the loss.

Game is less about fights, more about pressing an advantage in many ways and co-ordination.

I am against this because I feel like Riot is balancing around competitive play and leaving new-comers and people wanting a fun game - in the dust. It's becoming a war, not a game. With fun less of an orientation. While I enjoy beating people at a video game, it's becoming far less about skill and more so about co-operation. Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think it was better when it was a solo fest with a bit of grouping than it is now.
its funny how they wanted to tone down snowballing but they've ended up making it worse
havnt had a good fun close game in weeks... kinda puttin me off continuing to play tbh.

I realised this myself its probably due to the influx of champion changes. Like... I was like gold 3 or 2 when they nerfed alistar big last time. Now I only play him at like a gold 5 level and he's like my best chap. If you think how many major changes have been introduced to the game. Everyones sense of worth is getting thrown around with every tweak and yeah I think the only solution for riot to fix this is to slow down the changes a little. Like bringing 5 new champions into spotlight and basically deleting 5 like each of the last like 3 patches has done seems to be overkill. In the past it might have just been like an underplayed champion got a tiny bit of a buff or an op champ got a slight nerf but now its like we are going to give this champion a complete overhaul (gp, teemo... whatever the feel of the day is) then chuck in items that totally change the tempo of the game and yeah like I said bring a ton of champs into spotlight and made a few more obsolete for a while specifically ludens echo change then cinderhulk and then now the possible op thing running around is that on hit jungle item.
